intro: Tibouchina hutchisonii, commonly known as the Hibiscus hutchisonii, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Tibouchina hutchisonii thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
